results.title: My island home
results.creator_credit: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Lionel Austin, has lived in Melbourne all his life, his demons reside there. Where he finds his peace is Fraser Island, a natual wonderland and, ultimately, where his heart resides.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Grandfather TL
results.creator_credit: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Between generations
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rebecca Phillips considers how much has changed since her mother went to school. Perhaps she could now sit at the tables and play with the other kids, but she still felt ostracised for being different. Despite this, she has learnt to be proud of her heritage and found her place in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Rebecca Phillips considers how much has changed since her mother went to school. results.title: Pitcha this : the black cockatoos (Swan Hill) : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling, ACMI, Patty Donaczy, Marion Beeton, Ramptha Edwards, Judith Rigney and Daniel Edwards
results.brief_description: Six stories from members of the Swan Hill Indigenous community. Parents, children and inspirational family members are celebrated in these stories, connecting the participants to their heritage.

results.title: My tribe
results.creator_credit: Judith Rigney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Judith Rigney’s family are the love of her life. At age 22, Rigney gave birth to her first child. Here she proudly and lovingly pays tribute her ‘tribe’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith Rigney, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Mum and dad
results.creator_credit: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patty Donaczy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Patty Donaczy’s parents got married in Cootamundra and made news. Despite being an interracial couple, they overlooked the prejudices of the time and embraced a future together. Their memory will live on in their children and grandchildren.

results.title: Little Dolly : Shakira
results.creator_credit: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daniel Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Daniel Edwards’ little girl, Shakira, was born with Miller-Dieker syndrome, a congenital disorder. Edwards pays tribute to his late daughter, who he affectionately refers to as ‘Little Dolly’.

results.title: The Great cod fisher woman
results.creator_credit: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ramptha Edwards, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.
description_for_label: Ramptha Edwards tells the story of her mother, a strong Yorta-Yorta woman who provided for her family, even if that involved moving away to work. Her skills as a fisherwoman were well known and Edwards understands that its cod that connects her to her mother’s spirit.

results.title: Goanna
results.creator_credit: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Anna Williams, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Anna Williams’ story is ultimately about empowerment through music. Her uncle, Harry Williams, was a famous Indigenous country musician. Anna tells his story and how his influence and inspiration has helped to empower and heal Williams.

results.title: The Cape Barren boy
results.creator_credit: Marion Beeton, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Beeton is proud of his father, Clive Beeton. A talented musician who wrote his own songs, he learnt to play the guitar through listening to the wireless.
